intro: Sanicula elata var. chinensis, commonly known as Chinese sanicle, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and produces fruit capsules that release tiny seeds. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both traditional medicine and ecological studies.
